definitions.text: having intervening factors or persons or influences
examples: reflection from the ceiling provided a soft indirect light

definitions.text: not direct in spatial dimension; not leading by a straight line or course to a destination
examples: sometimes taking an indirect path saves time
you must take an indirect course in sailing

definitions.text: descended from a common ancestor but through different lines
examples: an indirect descendant of the Stuarts

definitions.text: extended senses; not direct in manner or language or behavior or action
examples: doubtless they had some indirect purpose in mind
though his methods are indirect they are not dishonest
known as a shady indirect fellow

definitions.text: not as a direct effect or consequence
